data.title: Webber Middle School
data.text:
Webber Panther Athletics

2024-2025 Athletics

Please check back periodically for updates about forthcoming seasons.

Participation:

6th graders can compete in all individual sports:

Fall: Tennis, Cross-Country

Winter: Wrestling

Spring: Golf, Track

7th and 8th graders can compete in all sports offered:

Fall: Tennis, Cross-Country, Football, Volleyball

Winter: Boys Basketball, Girls Basketball, Wrestling

Spring: Softball, Golf, Track, Unified Basketball

Team Sports Structure:

Volleyball, Basketball (cut sports)

Mixed Grade: Varsity, JV, C1, C2

Football, Softball

Mixed Grade: Varsity, JV

Registration Process

There are three main things your student will need to compete in a middle school sport:

1.) Specific team/sport registration:

All middle school students participating in PSD Athletics must complete the registration at https://www.psdathletics.org/msreg. To do this, please scroll to the bottom of the page and create an account with Sports Engine. Online registration still requires families to submit a hard copy of the physical form, complete with a doctor's signature.

2.) Sports physical (within one calendar year):

Submit a hard copy of the physical form, complete with a doctor's signature. The physical is valid for 365 days and expires one year from the original date of completion. If the physical expires during a season that an athlete is participating in, a new physical must be completed and submitted to continue to be eligible to play. This can be submitted to Jamie Hontz (jhontz@psdschools.org). A sports physical can be completed by a physician or chiropractor. or at the Health and Wellness Center at Lincoln Middle School or Centennial High School.

A physical can also be completed on a sliding scale ($0 - $35 for qualifying families) at the Health and Wellness Center at Lincoln Middle School or Centennial High School. For more information please call 970-488-4900.

3.) Payment or Waiver (for students who qualify for free or reduced lunch)

The athletic registration fee is $140 for PSD students and $210 for non-PSD students. Payments can be made via https://psdschools.schoolpay.com or with a check payable to Webber Middle School. The registration process and payment must be completed prior to the first official practice/tryout. Fees may be waived for students who are eligible for free or reduced-price meals. Please contact Jamie Hontz (Athletic Secretary) or Becca Wren (Athletic Director) if you need help with this process. If a student does not make the team, the fees are refundable.

Fall-Specific Athletic Updates

*Registration process does not need to be complete to attend pre-season camp. All steps must be completed by the first official practice to be eligible to try out/practice.

Football (7th + 8th Grade):

Summer Mini Camp (Optional): Wednesdays, July 10th, 17th, 24th, 31st, and August 7th, 10:00 am - 12:00 pm.

Meet on the football field. Please be in athletic attire and cleats, and bring a water bottle and sunscreen!

Pre-Season Camp (Optional): August 8th – 14th, 2:25 - 4:30pm

Meet on the football field. Please be in athletic attire and cleats, and bring a water bottle and sunscreen!

Football practices officially begin August 15th, 2:25 – 4:30 pm. All athletes must have all steps of the registration process completed before they are eligible to participate in official practice. Athletes should change into athletic attire (and helmets/pads once distributed), and meet on the field daily.

Volleyball (7th + 8th Grade):

Pre-Season Camp (Optional): August 12th – 14th, 2:30 - 3:45pm

Meet in the main gym. Please be in workout attire, and bring a water bottle!

Volleyball tryouts (and then practices) officially begin August 15th, 16th, 19th, and 20th from 2:30 – 4:30 pm. All athletes must have all steps of the registration process completed before they are eligible to participate in official practice. Athletes should change into athletic attire and meet in the main gym daily.

Cross Country (6th, 7th, 8th Grade):

Pre-Season Camp (Optional): August 15th – 21st, 2:35 – 4:15pm

Meet at the flagpole in front of the building. Please be in workout attire, bring a water bottle and sunscreen!

Cross Country practice officially begins August 22nd, 2:35 – 4:15pm. All athletes must have all steps of the registration process completed before they are eligible to participate in official practice. Athletes should change into athletic attire and meet at the flagpole daily.

Tennis (6th, 7th, 8th Grade):

Pre-Season Camp (Optional):

Boys: August 12th and 13th: 9:00 – 10:30, August 14th: 2:30 – 4:00

Girls: August 12th and 13th: 10:30 – 12:00, August 14th: 4:00 – 5:30

Meet at the tennis courts at Westfield Park. Please be in workout attire, bring a water bottle and sunscreen!

Tennis practices officially begin August 15th, 2:30 – 4:30 pm. Tryout dates are as follows:

Boys: August 19th + 20th: 2:30 – 4:00pm

Girls: August 21st + 22nd: 2:30 – 4:00pm

Boys + Girls Combined Practice (who’ve made the team): August 23rd: 2:30 – 4:00pm

Parent Meeting: August 23rd, 4:00pm

All athletes must have all steps of the registration process completed before they are eligible to participate in official practice. Athletes should change into athletic attire and meet at the tennis courts at Westfield Park.

Check back in October for Winter Season Updates!

If you have any questions, don’t hesitate to reach out.

Becca Wren

Assistant Principal/Athletic Director

Webber Middle School

rwren@psdschools.org

(work) 970-488-7857 - (mobile) 970-413-0578
